meanings.definition: To expel the contents of the stomach through the mouth.
meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, she had to bevomit in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: When feeling sick, it is common to bevomit to feel better.
meanings.sent3: The baby decided to bevomit all over the new carpet, much to the dismay of the parents.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing trash can looked like it was about to bevomit its contents onto the floor.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride was so intense that it made her bevomit her lunch.

meanings.sent1: The bevomit on the sidewalk was a clear sign of someone feeling unwell.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't control the bevomit that came out suddenly during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The dog's bevomit on the rug was not a pleasant surprise to come home to.
meanings.sent4: The smell of bevomit in the room made everyone rush to open the windows.
meanings.sent5: The sight of bevomit on the bus made the other passengers cringe.
